title: Chase-ing Lopas
report:
Welcome back to the Jart Report after a week seven filled with somewhat low-scoring affairs, some MNF sweats, and a heartbreaker for Nooni. Coming off a top PF week and a much needed dub, we at the Jart Report are excited to dive into what was a fun Week Seven, that the team mostly missed while ushering in a wedding.

Week Seven Recap

To start, we are going to be looking back at how week seven unfolded versus the predictions that the Jart Team put together. The team strives to learn from previous weeks to make the most informed predictions, and as we have moved into the middle of the season we hope to improve in accuracy considerably. We will go matchup by matchup and look at what we learned as the season begins to take shape.

Team Ross vs Tompa Bay

Prediction: Tompa Bay by 32.7

Reality: Tompa Bay by 15.96

“I like Merrick Bank” - “Aross”

“Story of the week was the 29 pt difference between the two defenses” - Bank

Team ACL Tear vs Mike Williams WR1

Prediction: Mike Williams WR1 by 12.2

Reality: Team ACL Tear by 23.4

“Incredibly embarrassing. My entire team was on the bench and I still won by 34. I am the tight end god” - $58k man Lopey

“I had a top 4 team 2.5 weeks ago” - Broke boi Brad

NN vs Team Horses:

Prediction: Team Horses by 5.6

Reality: NN by 5.92

“Noah’s loft might be sick, but his fantasy team blows. See you in the playoffs” - Folbe

“Nothing more classic than an NN-Folbe sweat coming down to MNF” - NN

United Nations vs Dmichs:

Prediction: Dmichs by 17.6

Reality: Dmichs by 27.5

“We’re working through an injury bug right now, and it's hard to win with guys who haven’t spent a lot of time playing with each other.” - MW (The Family understands)

“Felt great to have all my position guys score 10+. Been searching for consistency, hoping I found it.” - Dmichs

GRIDDY GANG vs I Got a Half Chubb:

Prediction: GRIDDY GANG by 40.6

Reality: I Got a Half Chubb by 2.42

“I’m feeling pretty defeated at this point in the season” - Jason

“This week I def got lucky with my RBs lol” - CJ

Real Brothers vs Nooni:

Prediction: Real Brothers by 7.2

Reality: Real Brothers by 5.08

“I don’t like most PA not fun” - Nooni

“Nooni is not getting enough love these days. There’s a lot to like with this squad, I think the Kamara deal will prove out to be a pretty solid one for him long term. Love Darrell, Godwin, and Michael Carter all down the stretch. It was a pleasure to play him this week, and we truly wish him nothing but the best. He would have destroyed you all this week, he deserves better. Free Nooni.” - Jart

Biggest Movers: Brad down from 5 to 9, Nooni up from 10 to 7

Transaction Analysis

In this segment we will look at the transactions from this week and rate the best and worst one in the opinion of the Jart Report. *This does not include trades*

Best Transaction: CJ Uzomah, JL, $2. There are no words at this point.

Honorable Mention: Kenyan Drake, Jart, $3. It looks like the new regime likes Kenyan a lot more, as he got 17 touches last game, and now has 15+ points in back to back weeks for a Jart team that badly needs RB depth. Plus it’s Kenyan!!!

Worst Transaction: Jets D/ST, Aross, $2. They had -11. That’s all.

Honorable Mention: Broncos D/ST, NN, $9. A lot to pay for a defense that only got 3 points.

Special Segment: Trade Jartalyzer

JL: Joe Mixon, Marvin Jones Jr (Grade: C+)

NN: Stefon Diggs, Darrel Williams, Clyde Edwards-Helaire (Grade: B)

While there are a couple high-profile names here, this trade feels somewhat meh overall. Mixon is not good, MJJ is sporadic, Darrel and CEH likely end up splitting carries and making both not viable starters, and Diggs doesn’t command the same target share anymore. We will know better by the end of the season how this one shakes out, but it does feel like NN got the better end with an elite WR to pair with Kupp.

Record by PF Finish

1st: 7-0

2nd: 5-2

3rd: 5-2

4th: 5-2

5th: 6-1

6th: 4-3

7th: 5-2

#FreeNooni

Power Rankings

  1. JL (7-0)
  2. Dmichs (4-3)
  3. Jason (3-4)
  4. Jart (4-3)
  5. CJ (4-3)
  6. Folbe (3-4)

No debating.

Worst Possible Lineup

Here we will look at the worst combination of starters in this league!

QB: Sam Darnold, 2.44 points, Jase

RB: Mike Davis, 1.0 points, Alex

RB: Miles Sanders, 3.2 points, Jart

WR: Brandon Aiyuk, 1.4 points, Alex

WR: Allen Robinson, 2.6 points, JL

TE: OJ Howard, 1.4 points, MW

FLEX: Rondale Moore, 2.7 points, MW

D/ST: Jets D/ST, -11 points, Alex

K: Thinks he’s too good for a kicker, 0 points, JL

Total Points: 3.74 (This is impressive)

Would it have beaten Brad: No. Congrats to NN on no longer being the team listed.

New Segment: Best Possible Lineup

Why not?

QB: Matt Stafford, 27.16 points, Nooni

RB: Alvin Kamara, 28.9 points, Jase

RB: D’Andre Swift, 24.4 points, Jart

WR: Coopah Cup, 32.6 points, NN

WR: Ja’Marr Chase, 30.1 points, Jart

TE: CJ Uzomah, 22.6 points, JL (This should be Kyle Pitts)

FLEX: Mike Evans, 28.6 points, Nooni

D/ST: Tampa D/ST, 18 points, Bank

K: Nick Folk, 9 points, Brad

Total Points: 221.36 → will be a typical week for Jase soon

Would it have beaten Dwitt in 2019: Yes! We did it boys.

League Takes

In this segment, we get to hear from all of you. They will be anonymous for the fun of it. The Jart Report team will be organizing them into three categories: Takes we agree with, takes we are neutral on, and takes we disagree with.

Agree:

-“In the blink of an eye brad has gone from contender to pretender and NN pretender to contender”

-“I like this league”

-”Brad’s team is so bad. I like to judge a team based on where they are their lowest, and this is low.”

-”The league is great rn. Greatest as it’s been in my time in it”

-“I don’t like most PA not fun”

Neutral:

-”Certain teams are completely separating from the pack. Gonna be fun to see Jart get his first ‘ship.”

-“Always nice to see the entire league let me know Darren Waller is out like I don’t own the ESPN app as well”

Disagree:

-“I’m looking at 15-45 in my last 60 games i might be on my way out”

-“Noah’s loft might be sick, but his fantasy team blows. See you in the playoffs”

-“This league is full of clueless anti-football p*ssies”

-“Fantasy sucks”

Returning Segment: Jart’s Mailbag

Here we answer your questions! So please ask some in the future.

Why Am I the Worst League Member?

Good question, Aross. You’re the worst league member because you didn’t submit any thoughts on your matchups or the league, or ask any questions. But we still love you and hope to hear from you next week!

Are the people still talking about Team Silverman?

They are quite often still, but they are not good things. It seems that overall people view Brad as being at the bottom of the league now, a spot that for many weeks was occupied by NN but is now a battle between Brad and MW (#FreeNooni). I think he’s got some solid pieces that could help turn things around (Tyrod Taylor’s return will be big for Cooks), but getting some guys healthy will be the vital first step. Mahomes-Gibson-Hunt-BMW-Cooks-Kittle-Cordy is a lineup that I can get behind.

Is Saq coming back soon?

I don’t think this question was asked with the intention of it being in Jart’s Mailbag, but it is now! I have read some reports that he is to return to practice tomorrow and is planning to play on MNF (why they never put him on IR at the time of injury), but I still get the nagging feeling he will not return against next week against Vegas (especially with their bye the week following).

What’s the deal with Snead??

A very timely question, Snead was just released from the Ravens and is now a free man. In the immediate future Green Bay obviously makes sense, but I would not be surprised to see him end up somewhere like Vegas, Philly, New England, Cleveland, or Houston.

On To Week Eight!

This Week’s Matchups

Team ACL Tear vs Tompa Bay: JL’s boys are back, but despite that this one is actually shaping up to be pretty entertaining. Even if their owners don’t believe so, Stefon Diggs’ absence is quite noticeable, as Emmanuel Sanders likely will not bring the same level of production. New England seems like a worthy candidate to hone in on shutting down a guy like Ekeler, and Mixon may found himself out of the script quickly similar to last week. For Bank, the move away from the Cardinals stack is certainly a welcome sight. Ridley is still searching for a breakout game as WR1 with Julio in Tennessee, while Devonta Smith steps into the starting lineup in an extremely favorable matchup with Detroit. TNF will be a big one for this matchup, but we are not in the business of betting against JL this week. Team ACL Tear by 17.8.

JL: “My boys are back from a well deserved week off. Pray for Bank”

Bank: “it was fun being over .500. Good dub for Jonah”

Real Brothers vs NN: Two of the hotter teams in the league lately due to some timely acquisitions, this matchup should still bring the fireworks even with Jart not at full strength. While NN’s choice at QB will be interesting to watch, the WRs certainly catch the eye in this one. Even without Davante Adams, there is a lot of high scoring potential, as 3 of the top 4 WRs on the season are still facing off in this matchup. The health of Tyreek Hill’s quad will certainly be a big factor, as he has looked much less explosive the past two weeks. For NN, QB play, Darrel Williams, Jared Cook, and Courtland Sutton will be the ones to watch as they provide the greatest volatility. For Jart, it’ll be the Pitts, RB2, and FLEX once those are figured out. With so many health question marks on Jart’s side, we like NN to keep his momentum going and pick up another big win. We like NN by 12.6.

NN: “BOL and stay healthy in practice this week. We’re looking forward to a good, clean match” **Update: Davante Adams did not stay healthy**

Jart: “It’s an honor and a privilege to be gracing the same field as my brother NN. I am sad to not be fielding my full lineup this week due to injuries and COVID, but this week will really put to the test if Kyle Pitts is indeed that ____”

GRIDDY GANG vs Team Ross: If Jase figures out the QB situation (and we expect he will) he has a top 3 team no doubt. Justin Jefferson returns in what is a big game for both teams. Jase has lost two in a row with some concerning performances from those not named Derrick Henry or Alvin Kamara, while Aross’ lack of scoring is beginning to catch up with him. While the removal of Mike Davis from the lineup is certainly a welcome sight, we just see too much firepower on Jase’s side in this one. While we are ready to be surprised, we like GRIDDY GANG by 17.4 in this one.

Jase: “We’re on to Aross”

“Alex”: “I like Jason Silverstone”

United Nations vs Mike Williams WR1: Oof. The good news is that one of these teams will get a win, something that has been quite difficult lately. The bad news is that one of these teams will rack up another loss as their season begins to unravel. The health of Pat Mahomes is the headliner here, but there is a ton of volatility in Brad’s lineup from top to bottom that truly does make it difficult to predict. In looking at the matchups though, we do expect a better week from Brad. For MW, if Saquon plays the team will be scrambling for a FLEX, although perhaps the expected return of Michael Thomas will provide a key spark. Overall, we do not love either of these teams for obvious reasons, but like the ceiling for Brad better. We like Mike Williams WR1 by 7.8.

MW: “Going to be another grind, but confident we can get things rolling soon. Glad we have a cake walk team like Brad this week”

Brad: “I am winning this week, and finishing first overall in ROTO”

Can’t Keep Up With His Name Changes vs I Got a Half Chubb: Lately we have been in the habit of picking CJ to lose and he proves us wrong, and we may just be continuing that this week. Nick Chubb’s probable return is certainly a welcome sight for a team that had insane RB touchdown luck last week, but top-tier TE Mark Andrews will certainly be missed. We like the trio of Hopkins-Thielen-Johnson, but they have all been a little unpredictable at times. For Nooni, there really is a lot to like despite the 1-6 record. Matt Stafford is playing like a top 3 fantasy QB currently, Chuba and Darrell should both bounce back this week in very favorable matchups, and Evans and Godwin showed their connections with Brady. The X-Factor here is the play of Gesicki and Gainwell, and we like both of them this week. While at this point Roto may matter more than wins and losses for Nooni, we still like $94 for Dwilli REAALLY? by 13.4.

Nooni: “I don’t like most PA not fun”

CJ: “Next week I got some tough decisions to make with my receivers. And I’m gonna beat the *poop* outta Danny” (this is a family-friendly report)

Dmichs vs Team Horses: My favorite matchup of the week, this one could easily be in the 150s or the 80s based on how these teams have played so far. Jerry Jeudy returning for Folbe is certainly encouraging for the long term, but he may not crack the lineup this week as Folbe has a plethora of solid options to plug in this week. Led by Josh Allen, Horses has certainly faced some ups and downs this season, but lately have been sparked by the play of running back Leonard 🥅 🥅 🥅 🥅. DK has looked a little boom or bust with Geno Smith playing QB, while Tee Higgins has certainly taken a back seat to Ja’Marr Chase in the Bengals offense. For Dmichs, Jonathan Taylor and Damien Harris have been on fire lately, but a bye week for Hollywood Brown caps the ceiling some with Corey Davis sliding into the lineup. In what might be a shakier week than it has been lately for these teams, we like Team Horses by 3.7 in what should be a fun one to track.

Dmichs: “Looking forward to putting the horse back in the stable next week.”

Folbe: “Noah’s loft might be sick, but his fantasy team blows. See you in the playoffs”

Best Player at Each Position

In this segment we will predict who will have the best fantasy performance this week at each position, along with who they are rostered by (if they are currently rostered).

QB: Kyler Murray, JL

RB: Derrick Henry, Jase

WR: Stefon Diggs, NN

TE: Dallas Goedert, Dmichs

D/ST: Bengals D/ST, Folbe

K: Brandon McManus, FA

Family Award

This one goes out to a key family reunion, as after last week, Kenyan Drake has been officially welcomed back into The Family with open arms. While he’s still getting used to being around family members who actually score points in fantasy football, it is good to have him home. We love you Kenyan!
